meanings.definition: To offer or present for acceptance.
meanings.sent1: She proffers her hand in friendship.
meanings.sent2: He proffers his resignation to the company.
meanings.sent3: The magician proffers a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The sun proffers its warmth to the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The waiter proffers the menu with a smile.

meanings.sent1: The proffers of peace were met with skepticism.
meanings.sent2: She considered the proffers from different universities.
meanings.sent3: The proffers of free ice cream drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: His proffers of help were always genuine.
meanings.sent5: The proffers of assistance came at just the right time.
